bibl.title: M. L. Coovert for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1890-1901, vol 1

div1.p: US Circuit Court District of Washington
Ex parte M. L. Coovert
Bond. Jul 31 1893
Filed Jul 31 1893 189 In the U.S. Circuit Court A. Reeves Ayres. Clerk By R. M. Hopkins Deputy
In the Circuit Court of the United States for the Ninth Circuit, District of Washington, Northern Division.
Ex parte
M. L. Coovert. On Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
United States of America ) District of Washington ) SS County of King. )

Know all men by these presents, that we, M. L. Coovert, of Vancouver, in the State of Washington, as principal, and M. A. Arilbron, of Seattle, in the State of Washington, as surety, are held and firmly bound unto the Clerk of the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington in the penal sum of Two Hundred and Fifty ($250) Dollars, lawful money of the United States, for the payment of which, well and truly to be made, we, and each of us, bind ourselves, our heirs, executors and administrators, jointly, severally and firmly by these presents.
Signed by our hands and sealed without seals this 31 day of July, 1893.

The Condition of the foregoing obligation is such that Whereas, the said M. L. Coovert, principal above named, was, on the 9th day of June, 1893, arrested by George Nerton, Sheriff of the County of Clarke, in said state, at Vancouver, in said county and state, by virtue of a warrant of commitment, issued by E. A. Wiswall, Judge of the Superior Court of the State of Washington for said County of Clarke, sitting and acting as a committing magistrate, for an alleged violation by said Coovert of a certain law
of the State of Washington declaring it to be unlawful for any person or persons whatever to manufacture, buy, sell, give or furnish to anyone any cigarettes, cigarette paper or cigarette wrapper; it being charged that the said Coovert had sold to one C. M. McDonald a package of cigarettes, consisting of a slide pasteboard box, said box packed with others in a common pin shipping case, which said package was shipped to said Coovert by the American Tobacco Company from the State of Oregon to the State of Washington; all as more particularly set forth in the petition of the said M. L. Coovert, heretofore filed herein, for a writ of habeas corpus; and

Whereas, on the 22nd day of June, 1893, said cause was duly heard in this court on a demurrer to the petition and on the return to the writ of habeas corpus issued out of this court on the 13th day of June, 1893; and

Whereas, by said order of the 22nd day of June, 1893, it was ordered and required thatthe said M. L. Coovert should enter into a Bond in the sum of Two Hundred and Fifty ($250.00) Dollars, with one or more sureties, for his apearance to answer the judgement of the appellate court herein,

Now, therefore, if the said M. L. Coovert shall appear and answer the judgement of the appellate court in the premises, and abide by and obey such judgement or order as the appellate court may render or make, or cause to be tendered or made by the Circuit
Court of the United States above named, then this obligation to be void; otherwise to remain in full force and virtue.
M L Coovert (Seal) M. A. Arilbron (Seal)
Signed, Sealed &Delivered in Presence of L B Steden
Taken and acknowledged before me this 31 day of July 1893. R. M. Hopkins Deouty Clerk, U. S. Circuit Court, District of Washington.
United States of America ) District of Washington ) SS County of King ) )

M A Aribbron being first duly sworn, deposes and says: That he is the surety named in the foregoing Bond; that he is not a sheriff, clerk of court, attorney at law, or any other officer of any court in the State of Washington; that he is a citizen, resident and freeholder in said State of Washington, and is worth at least the sum of Two Hundred and Fifty ($250.00) Dollars, over and above all his juts debts and liabilities, exclusive of property exempt from execution. M. A. Arilbron
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 31 day of July, 1893.
L. B. Stedden Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at seattle, King County, in said state.
